TZ.description: Which time zone to display the calendar events in, such as `Pacific/Auckland`. See a full list in the “TZ database name” field at https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_tz_database_time_zones

ICAL_FEEDS.description: An optional list of iCal feed URLs separated by spaces. For Google Calendars, look for the “address in iCal format” URLs in the calendar's settings.

MEETUP_COM_GROUPS.description: An optional list of Meetup.com groups to subscribe to, separated by spaces. A group can be the full URL (e.g. `https://www.meetup.com/Christchurch-Ruby-Group/`) or the URL slug (e.g. `Christchurch-Ruby-Group`). Requires MEETUP_COM_API_KEYS also be set.

MEETUP_COM_API_KEYS.description: If retrieving events from Meetup.com, you need to specify one or more API keys to use. You can find your API key at https://secure.meetup.com/meetup_api/key. If you have a lot of groups, use multiple API keys to avoid hitting API request limits separated by spaces.

CACHE_DURATION_IN_SECONDS.description: How long to keep calendar events cached for. Set to `0` to always show an up-to-date calendar, but be wary of API request limits when using Meetup.com. Default is 15 minutes.

DAYS_LOOKAHEAD.description: How many days of events to display on the calendar
